title: Presales Lead Cybersecurity
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**The role**
 You will be part of Capgemini's
 **Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS)** 
 unit, focusing on project and consulting services in the Nordics. Our goal is to offer customers comprehensive cloud solutions with industry-specific expertise, advanced cloud technology, and global resources. We offer a variety of services to our customers, from strategic advice to project implementation.
   

  

 This Role sits at the heart of the customer business problem in creating and proposing the best of Capgemini as a solution that is a match for the client requirement. You engage with the customer, either proactively or via request, to draw out the business challenges that they have and align the Capgemini solution portfolio to it. Communicating the solution to the client, you demonstrate the value that Capgemini adds and how we are differentiated to meet and exceed their business needs.
   

  

 The role needs a techno-functional visionary leader with strategic thinking and a strong knowledge of Cloud and Infrastructure solutions with a particular focus on Cyber Security, PAM and IAM.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

* Actively develop and drive strategic and tactical opportunities within the Nordics
* Collaborating with Market and Portfolio sales teams to identify potential customers and develop a deep understanding of their technical and business requirements
* Engage with the client in a compelling and collaborative way to establish trust and understand their business and how Capgemini can help them
* Develop compelling cost effective/compelling solutions using the best of Capgemini to exceed client expectations
* Provide technical and sector guidance and support throughout the sales process, including responding to inquiries, conducting assessments, and developing proposals
* Participate in industry events and conferences to share your knowledge and expertise and network with customers and partners showing thought leadership
* Act as a Nordic SPOC for the Cyber GTM organization, leveraging additional resource capacity from the global Cyber organization
* When required, operate as a Solution Lead or Solution Architect to provide essential deal capacity
* Work across our partner organisations to bring the best of their products/services together with Capgemini services (Microsoft, Z Scaler). Strong knowledge and experience of industry standard Cyber and Access Management tooling platforms is essential, including EntraID and AD


**Your profile**
* Demonstrable experience of navigating a large matrixed Service Provider type organizations including Run (Managed Services) and Projects and Consulting structures
* Strong transformation/change and solutions expertise
* Full working proficiency in English
* Demonstrated ability to develop and deliver compelling technical demonstrations and presentations
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to understand and address complex technical challenges


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person


*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: IT-säkerhetskonsult med fokus på backup & återläsning
description:
Vi söker en erfaren konsult med teknisk expertis inom IT-säkerhet och applikationslandskap för att stödja ett uppdrag kopplat till säkerhetsrelaterade frågeställningar i en hybrid molnmiljö. Uppdraget fokuserar särskilt på backup- och återläsningsprocesser, med syfte att stärka förmågan att hantera avancerade cyber- och ransomwareattacker samt säkerställa tillgängligheten av kritiska applikationer.
   

  

 Uppdragsbeskrivning / arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Planera, beställa, verifiera och analysera återställningstester (4–6 stycken) baserat på en prioriterad lista.
* Genomföra tester i samarbete med produktledare utan att verksamheten påverkas negativt.
* Dokumentera och leverera genomförda återläsningstester för kritiska applikationer.
* Driva undersökande arbete, avtalshantering och möten med leverantörer och interna intressenter.
* Arbeta operativt och taktiskt med backup- och återläsningsfrågor samt tillhörande arbetssätt.


 Skallkrav
   

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av utredande arbete och strukturerat genomförande.
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserad IT-säkerhet.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av backup- och återläsningslösningar i hybrida IT-miljöer.
* God kunskap inom applikationsarkitektur.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure (drift och backup).


 Meriterande
   

  

* Erfarenhet som cloudarkitekt, IT-arkitekt eller teknisk specialist inom moln och applikationslandskap.


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

* Analytisk och noggrann i sitt arbete.
* Proaktiv och tar initiativ för att driva arbetet framåt.
* Planerande och strukturerad med förmåga att hålla deadlines.
* Resultat- och kvalitetsfokuserad med stark kundorientering.
* Teknisk expert som delar med sig av kunskap och bidrar till utveckling.


**Start:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Slut:** 
 2025-06-30, med möjlighet till förlängning
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 ca 50%
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Stockholm

title: Supply Chain Transformation Lead
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*
 Your role
   

  

 Deliver transformation initiatives across Saab Surveillance’s global supply chain from bottom-up needs to measurable outcomes. Collect and synthesize requirements from operating countries and shop floors, align them with business strategy and the SCE roadmap, co-design robust solutions with PM&T and IFS Solutions Architects, and drive on-time, on-budget execution with clear benefits to capacity, on-time delivery, and cost.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Portfolio Intake & Prioritization**
* Establish a structured intake from Business Partners and shop-floor functions (planning, sourcing, logistics, inventory, manufacturing etc).
* Translate needs into clear problem statements and business cases; consolidate into a transparent, sequenced backlog.
* Align the portfolio with business strategy and the SCE roadmap; facilitate prioritization with HoSCE and stakeholders, managing cross-OPC/BU interdependencies.
* Responsible for RACI


**Project Planning & Governance**
* Produce project charters, delivery plans, and milestone roadmaps; baseline scope, budget, and timelines.
* Run day-to-day governance (RAID, change control, decision logs) and working forums.
* Coordinate resources across PM&T, IFS teams, and local contributors; proactively remove blockers.
* Produce and evidence earned value / milestone burn-down expectations in status reporting.


**Solution Co-Design (with PM&T and IFS Architecture)**
* Partner with PM&T and IFS Solutions Architects to design scalable, maintainable solutions spanning process, data, integrations, controls, and non-functionals.
* Translate business needs into epics/user stories or BRDs; validate process fit using S&OE/S&OP principles.
* Plan enablement and adoption: training (e.g., ClickLearn), super-user readiness, and Hypercare handover.


**Delivery Execution & Benefits Realization**
* Manage delivery to milestones and acceptance criteria; ensure SIT/UAT readiness, cutover, and stabilization.
* Track value using KPIs (throughput, lead time, on-time delivery, inventory health, cost).
* Lead post-implementation reviews; capture lessons learned and standardize successful patterns.


**Digitalization & Standards**
* Advance adoption of IFS capabilities and data-driven decision frameworks for visibility, predictability, and responsiveness.
* Define future-state operating models and best practices for repeatable scale across OPCs.


**Cross-BU Orchestration & External Partners**
* Coordinate cross-functional and cross-BU initiatives to increase throughput, reduce lead time, and minimize supply risk.
* Manage external consultants and tech providers against scoped deliverables and measurable value – manage KPI’s


**Capability Building**
* Strengthen governance, performance management, demand/supply balancing, and S&OE–S&OP integration.
* Support local champions and super-users to sustain outcomes.


 Your profile
   

  

* IFS experience (essential): hands-on delivery in IFS (Cloud or Apps) across SCM/manufacturing/inventory/planning/procurement; familiarity with integrations, data migration/quality, and SIT/UAT.
* Strong analytical, reporting, and planning skills; executive-ready status reporting and KPI storytelling.
* Proven stakeholder engagement from shop floor to COO governance; excellent facilitation and communication.
* Change management and operational governance experience.
* Influence without authority, conflict resolution, storytelling using data.


**Strong Plus**
* Portfolio/backlog management and roadmap alignment.
* Tooling: Jira or Azure DevOps, Excel (advanced), Power BI, Miro, PowerPoint.
* Certifications: PMP/PRINCE2; Agile/Scrum; Prosci (nice-to-have).
* International exposure; willingness to travel to OPCs as needed.
* English fluency (Swedish a plus).


 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

title: IT-arkitekt till Sveriges Radio
description:
Företagsbeskrivning gömd på alla jobb på hela kontot. Kontakta Jobylon för att visa igen.
   

  

*När du lyssnar på Sveriges Radio är det 100 års konstant teknikutveckling från en arena i teknologins framkant du hör. Bakom varje program och sändning, i varenda kanal och plattform, finns ett kraftfullt fundament av innovativ teknologi som verkar tyst i bakgrunden, dygnet runt, året om, med oerhörda krav på precision och stabilitet. Är man en del av totalförsvaret så är man. Kraven på oss framåt är om möjligt ännu högre. Vi är idag över 300 IT-experter som ser till att ge röst åt fler röster och starkare berättelser för en större förståelse. Vill man vara med och göra skillnad, på riktigt, ja då ska man jobba med tech på Sveriges Radio.*
**Tjänsten och ansvarsområden**
 Nu söker vi på Sveriges Radio en erfaren IT-arkitekt. I rollen kommer du att ha ett helhetsperspektiv med fokus på IT-infrastruktur och tekniska plattformar. En viktig del av ditt arbete är att vara en teknisk ledare och att säkerställa att tekniska mål och prioriteringar går i linje med verksamhetens strategiska mål.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar
   

  

* Tillsammans med kollegor vid avdelningen ansvara för Sveriges Radios totala IT-arkitektur.
* Driva beslutsprocess för övergripande IT-arkitektur och teknikval, inklusive utbredd förankring.
* Leda och koordinera arkitekturarbete tillsammans med andra tekniska ledare i en agil produktorganisation.
* Utveckla arkitekturarbetet så att det hänger ihop från strategisk, taktisk till operativ nivå.
* Bidra till den strategiska utvecklingen av tekniska plattformar, inklusive att identifiera och prioritera teknikval och lösningar.
* Designa arkitektur och balansera krav på plattformar inom infrastruktur, ljud, data och applikationer med mikrotjänster i privata och publika molnmiljöer.
* Omsätta teknikstrategi till målarkitekturer och strategiska tekniska planer.
* Säkerställa robusta, säkra och skalbara plattformar för högpresterande lösningar.
* Arbeta med arkitektur för event- och realtidsbaserade och API-drivna integrationer.
* Vägleda och coacha team och ledare i att utveckla för våra plattformar, inklusive teknisk rådgivning och bygga arkitekturell förmåga i organisationen.


 I rollen blir du en del av Sveriges Radios avdelning för IT-arkitektur. Du kommer att arbeta i nära samarbete med teamet, men också i den virtuella tekniska organisationen med Tech Leads på andra avdelningar.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har**
 Vi söker dig som har en bakgrund som senior teknisk ledare eller senior management-konsult inom teknik. Vi letar efter någon som har erfarenhet av IT-arkitektur inom tekniska plattformar, och som trivs med att coacha och vägleda ledare och team, samtidigt med förmågan att se helheten, hur det hänger ihop och hur den tekniska förflyttningen behöver utformas på bästa sätt.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Minst kandidatutbildning inom IT
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet från tekniskt ledande roll, t ex IT-arkitekt, med ansvar för helhetslösningar inom IT-infrastruktur och / eller tekniska plattformar
* Erfarenhet av infrastruktur, containerplattformar, mikrotjänster och cloud-native.
* Naturlig brobyggare och förändringsledare som skapar aha-upplevelser hos andra.
* Högt driv och förmåga att jobba tvärfunktionellt.
* Ett growth mindset och håller dig uppdaterad om teknikutvecklingen och hur det skapar värde
* Du agerar naturligt som en trusted advisor och anpassar budskap till företagsledning, produktchefer, utvecklare, team m.m.


*Meriterande är magisterexamen inom relevant område och tidigare erfarenhet från mediebranschen.*
**Anställning**
 Vi erbjuder en tillsvidaretjänst på heltid med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Rollen är placerad i Stockholm men distansarbete kan förekomma några dagar i veckan beroende på arbetets art.
   

  

*På Sveriges radio samlas medarbetare med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och perspektiv – något vi ser som en förutsättning för att skapa innehåll som är relevant, trovärdigt och tillgängligt för hela samhället.
   

  

 För att fortsätta bredda våra perspektiv och utvecklas som organisation ser vi varje rekrytering som en chans att växa. Vi välkomnar alla att söka våra tjänster – men vill särskilt uppmuntra kvinnor att söka denna roll, då vi i dag har en överrepresentation av män inom IT-enheten.*
**Ansökan och kontaktuppgifter**
 Sista ansökningsdag är
 **21 december,** 
 urval och intervjuer sker efter jul-och nyårshelgerna.
   

  

 Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av Robert Nordh, chefarkitekt, robert.nordh@sr.se.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
*Sveriges Radio är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur och har en viktig roll inom totalförsvaret. Vår verksamhet omfattas bland annat av regler om säkerhetsskydd och på grund av det genomförs en kontroll av kandidaten för många av tjänsterna i vår verksamhet innan anställning sker. För de tjänster som leder till deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet eller placering i säkerhetsklass innebär denna kontroll att säkerhetsprövning genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.*

title: Senior SAP Integration Architect
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of tech-savvy and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design, and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where every individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, everyone can be themselves while respecting others for who they are. We believe that when an amazing mix of people come together and share their knowledge, experiences, and ideas, we can help our clients on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who can start immediately and wants to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to make real progress in your career and the chance to take on significant responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a
 **Senior SAP Integration Architect** 
 who is passionate about solving complex integration challenges across diverse platforms—Azure, GCP, SAP BTP, and on-premise systems. This role requires deep expertise in SAP integration patterns and modern cloud engineering practices to help standardize integration approaches as the organization advances through its S/4HANA transformation journey.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Work closely with Product Owners, stakeholders, and cross-domain product teams to support the transition to S/4HANA.
* Assess the integration impact of the S/4HANA transformation and guide teams through required changes.
* Perform requirement analysis, identify gaps, and propose standardized integration solutions wherever possible.
* Design composable cloud integration architectures aligned with enterprise standards.
* Promote modern integration patterns and drive consistent adoption across teams.


 Qualifications
   

  

* Extensive hands-on experience in SAP integration across SAP BTP, SAP Integration Suite, SAP ISA-M, S/4HANA, and on-premise SAP ECC.
* Strong knowledge of SAP middleware and integration technologies, including:
+ APIs, IDocs, BAPIs, RFCs, OData services
+ Full SAP Integration Suite capabilities: Cloud Integration (CPI), API Management, Event Mesh, Open Connectors, etc.

* Practical experience applying SAP ISA-M (Integration Strategy & Assessment Methodology) and using the SAP Integration Assessment Tool to evaluate and architect integration landscapes.
* Proven ability to design and implement end-to-end integration scenarios between SAP and non-SAP systems.
* Strong understanding of cloud-to-on-prem connectivity, integration security, authentication methods, and data transfer protocols.
* Ability to define and document integration patterns, standards, best practices, and high-quality architectural deliverables.
* Solid troubleshooting skills for resolving complex integration issues across distributed systems.
* Experience supporting integration aspects of ERP transformations, especially migrations from ECC to S/4HANA.
* Familiarity with modern cloud architecture principles and designing composable, scalable, API-driven integration solutions.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Start date:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Mode of Work:** 
 Remote
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.
   

  

 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

title: Senior Manager - Data Management and Enterprise Architecture Expert within Management Consulting
description:
**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly performing and experienced Senior Data Management and Enterprise Architecture Professional to join our team within Management Consulting. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, data governance, and data analytics as well as working with Business and IT Architecture, with a proven track record of delivering successful projects. This will involve working closely with clients to understand and approach their data challenges. This includes developing and implementing data strategies and enterprise architecture design to ensure data quality, compliance and the effective utilization of data for strategy deployment.
   

  

 The role can be placed in Stockholm or Gothenburg, depending on your location and preference.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Lead and manage projects in the data management and enterprise architecture area, ensuring timely and successful delivery
* Develop and implement data governance frameworks and policies to ensure data quality, integrity, compliance and security
* Drive and lead initiatives within the enterprise architecture domain, addressing strategic questions related to application landscapes, system integration, data flows, platform selection, and alignment with business capabilities
* Collaborate with clients to understand their data requirements and provide tailored data solutions
* Design and implement data architectures and data models to support business objectives
* Actively drive the collaboration with sectors/accounts and KPMG global capabilities to identify opportunities and drive business development
* Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data management and analytics


 ,
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
* Minimum of 12 years of experience in data management and enterprise architecture or related fields
* Strong knowledge of data governance frameworks, data quality management, and data protection regulation
* Experience working with modern data platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake, Microsoft Azure Data Platform, or other relevant technologies
* Hands-on experience with data migration, integration, and building scalable data pipelines across modern cloud or on-premise environments
* Experience with AI and machine learning technologies
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and team members
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects and deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines


**Why Join KPMG**
**Global Network:** 
 Be part of a global network of professionals and gain access to international projects and knowledge sharing
   

  

**Career Development:** 
 Benefit from continuous learning and development opportunities, including training courses, mentorship programs, and career progression pathways
   

  

**Inclusive Culture:** 
 Work in an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone's ideas and contributions are valued
   

  

**Impactful Work:** 
 Make a lasting, positive impact on clients and society through meaningful and challenging work
   

  

 At KPMG, we are committed to fostering a culture of integrity, excellence, and collaboration. We believe in empowering our people to make a positive impact on our clients, communities, and society. Our values guide our actions and help us achieve our vision of being the preferred insights-led professional services firm.
   

  

 If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for digital transformation and a commitment to excellence, we invite you to join our team at KPMG and help us shape the future of our clients' businesses.
   

  

**Make a difference with us?**
 We welcome and look forward to receiving your application also during the summer, the selection process will begin at the start of August.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se

title: Sales Enablement
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: AI Technical Product Manager
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 Sinch is on a multi-year journey to responsibly scale AI across Enterprise IT (EIT). We're looking for a Specialist AI Technical Product Manager to take ownership of core AI capabilities as part of the EIT domain to ensure AI is safe, effective, and enterprise-ready.
 



 You'll partner closely with our central AI Function (responsible for end-user experience, including agent configuration and design) and act as the bridge to Infrastructure, End-User Support, Security, and other IT teams. You'll define, deliver, and continuously improve the technical products, integrations, and operating model that enable AI at scale.
 



 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid) and reports to the VP, Business Operations EIT.
 



**What You'll Do** 



* Own the AI Product Strategy: Define and manage the roadmap for enterprise AI capabilities, including connectors, LLM services, governance tools, and guardrails.
* Deliver Secure Integrations: Design and implement AI connectors for platforms like Microsoft 365, Slack, Jira, SAP, and data warehouses, ensuring performance and resilience.
* Build Knowledge Foundations: Set standards for data ingestion, classification, enrichment, and retention to power AI systems while protecting sensitive information.
* Drive AI Quality & Safety: Define success metrics, run A/B tests, and establish monitoring for drift, hallucinations, and compliance.
* Ensure Security & Compliance: Collaborate with Security, Legal, and Privacy teams to meet ISO 27001, SOC 2, and GDPR requirements; create incident response playbooks.
* Enable Adoption: Develop support playbooks, training programs, and clear roles across IT and business units to scale AI responsibly.



**REQUIREMENTS** 



* **Education** 
 : Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (Master's preferred).
* **Experience** 
 : 3+ years in Product Management or Technical Program roles delivering AI/ML or data-driven products in enterprise environments.
* **Technical Expertise** 
 :
	+ Hands-on with LLMs and platforms like OpenAI, Anthropic, Azure OpenAI, AWS Bedrock (Google Agentspace is a plus).
	+ Familiarity with RAG architectures, embeddings, prompt management, and evaluation frameworks.
	+ Experience building secure APIs/connectors (REST/GraphQL) and working with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
	+ Knowledge of enterprise IT systems (Microsoft 365, Jira, Slack) and identity/access management (Azure AD, Okta).
* **Security & Compliance** 
 : Strong grounding in data privacy, DLP, PII handling, and audit requirements.
* **Ways of Working** 
 : Comfortable with Agile/Scrum; able to write clear PRDs and architecture diagrams.
* **Soft Skills** 
 : Excellent communication and stakeholder management; proven ability to influence and lead change.
* **Nice to Have** 
 : ITIL v4 and cloud certifications.



**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Partner Business Manager - HPE Networking
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
 HPE Networking in Sweden is looking for a talented
 **Partner Business Manager** 
 to join the team.
   

  

**In a typical day as a Partner Business Manager – HPE Networking you would:**
* Serve as a trusted advisor to the Partner on where to play within emerging trends in Partner's ecosystem in alignment with HPE business priorities.
* Hunt and grow with and for new partners is key focus.
* Work with the Partner to create a mutually beneficial plan for the future.
* Drive end-to end HPE revenue, profitability, and pipeline by creating joint business plans and leading data-driven sales efforts with the Partner.
* Develop solid knowledge of partner priorities, industry trends, IT landscape, IT investment strategy, HPE priorities, and HPE Technology and communicates value of the portfolios and solutions to better differentiate HPE from competitors.
* Demonstrate business and sales leadership by building mutually beneficial relationships with Partners to grow HPE market share.
* Coordinate and execute HPE activities with the Partner, leveraging HPE specialists when needed, including sales cadence, education, marketing, executive briefings, proactive forecasting, business planning, and client engagements. Drives HPE marketing strategy through the customer.
* Drive and implement HPE strategy, programs, and systems with and on behalf of the Partner to assure accelerated financial outcomes and build partner loyalty to HPE


**Your Background And Skills**
* University or Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent experience.
* Typically 5+ years of experience in IT Sales.
* Experience in working with partners and within network and security are beneficial
* Solid awareness of current technology trends and related HPE strategy and ability to articulate same to Partner.
* Solid understanding of business and financial fundamentals to develop strategic plans with the partner that are aligned to customer and HPE strategies, creating increased business opportunities and value for HPE.
* You’re curious, eager to learn and able to adapt to a fast-paced environment
* You’re a team player
* Solid understanding of Partner industry, trends, competitors, and the channel.
* Ability to look forward and anticipate partner needs, proactively forecasting sales quota and effectively bridging sales gaps.
* Professional, clear, and effective verbal and written communication.
* Fluent Swedish and English languages


**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Unconditional Inclusion**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #sweden
   

  

 #aruba
   

  

**Job**
 Sales
   

  

**Job Level**
 Expert
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or any other protected category, and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.
   

  

**No Fees Notice & Recruitment Fraud Disclaimer**
*It has come to HPE’s attention that there has been an increase in recruitment fraud whereby scammer impersonate HPE or HPE-authorized recruiting agencies and offer fake employment opportunities to candidates. These scammers often seek to obtain personal information or money from candidates.*
*Please note that Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), its direct and indirect subsidiaries and affiliated companies, and its authorized recruitment agencies/vendors
 **will never charge any candidate a registration fee, hiring fee, or any other fee in connection with its recruitment and hiring process.** 
 The credentials of any hiring agency that claims to be working with HPE for recruitment of talent should be verified by candidates and candidates shall be solely responsible to conduct such verification. Any candidate/individual who relies on the erroneous representations made by fraudulent employment agencies does so at their own risk, and HPE disclaims liability for any damages or claims that may result from any such communication.*

title: Service Specialist, Stock Preparation Equipment
description:
Do you enjoy solving real-world technical challenges and working hands-on with advanced equipment?
   

  

 At Valmet, we are shaping the future of sustainable packaging and paper solutions through innovation, collaboration, and a seamless lifecycle approach. Join us in advancing the packaging and paper business, as we move forward with our renewed strategy to Lead the Way. This means pioneering smarter technologies, expanding our service capabilities, and delivering customer value across the entire lifecycle—from raw material to finished product. If you're ready to make a real impact in a dynamic, future-focused environment, we invite you to grow with us.
   

  

 Valmet’s Field Services carries out maintenance, refurbishment, and improvement projects primarily for customers and technologies within the paper and pulp industries. Our particular strengths include solid experience in executing challenging projects as well as professional interaction with customers in various Stock Preparation processes.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Service Specialist to join our Field Service team** 
 working with Stock Preparation equipment.
   

  

 As a Service Specialist, you will guide and carry out practical maintenance and servicing tasks at our customer sites. You will work closely with our customers in Scandinavia and Europe as well as globally. You will independently prepare and execute maintenance tasks and report completed assignments promptly and in the required manner.
   

  

 What do we expect from you?
   

  

 To succeed in this Service Specialist role, we expect you to have experience working with Stock Preparation equipment, especially disc filters and hydrocyclones. In addition, we value genuine interest and motivation to deliver assignments that create added value for our customers and to successfully solve challenges related to their equipment and processes. Occupational safety and proactive safety development are an inherent part of your work and working style.
   

  

 Alongside independent practical duties, you enjoy teamwork and project management. You are ready to take responsibility and make decisions within your remit.
   

  

 We expect a qualified candidate to have a flexible, proactive, and customer-oriented approach to work. Travelling to customer sites is an essential part of the job, so you must be prepared to travel also abroad. Occasional urgent assignments may also require flexibility to work outside regular hours.
   

  

 Your educational background is in a technical field. You have the skills to communicate fluently in English, Finnish and/or Swedish, both spoken and written. Other language skills are considered an advantage. You possess sufficient IT skills, including mobile tools, and you use Microsoft Office and cloud-based applications efficiently.
   

  

 The Stock Preparation Field Service team is based in Valmet’s offices in Tampere, Finland and Stockholm, Sweden, and we aim primarily to fill this position at one of these locations.
   

  

 What do we offer
   

  

 We offer you diverse and demanding tasks in an international environment, as well as the opportunity for continuous professional growth. At Valmet, you’ll work with highly trained professionals and be involved with leading and innovative technology and interesting customer projects. Our onboarding process and dedicated team will support and guide you as you start in your new role.
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 Interested? For more information about the position, please contact Max Jansson, Manager, SPR Services, tel. +358 40 731 6529 or max.jansson@valmet.com.
   

  

 We review applications as we receive them, so please fill in the electronic application form as soon as possible, but
 **no later than 01/12/2025** 
 . Please attach your CV and salary request.
   

  

 We encourage our employees to a healthier lifestyle by being a smoke-free Workplace.
   

  

*When everything works together*
*Valmet is where the best talent from a wide variety of backgrounds comes together. With over 19,000 professionals around the world, we are the leading global developer and supplier of technologies, automation and services for the pulp, paper and energy industries, and serve an even wider base of process industries with our automation systems and flow control solutions. Our commitment to moving our customers’ performance forward requires creativity, technological innovations, service know-how – and above all, teamwork.* 
*www.valmet.com/careers*

title: Techlead Datacenter
description:
*Vill du ha en nyckelroll i att etablera och driva en av Sveriges mest kritiska infrastrukturer? Trivs du i skärningspunkten mellan teknik, säkerhet, drift och strategisk utveckling? Bankgirot befinner sig just nu i en historiskt stor moderniseringsresa – och söker dig som vill vara med och göra skillnad i rollen som Tech Lead Datacenter.* 




  





*Det här är en möjlighet att kliva in mitt i transformationen, där två datacenter redan är igång, ett tredje är på väg – och allt ska skalas, optimeras och automatiseras. Du får en unik chans att sätta riktningen, skapa struktur, utmana lösningar och säkerställa att Sveriges framtida betalflöden vilar på en modern, säker och redundant infrastruktur. Välkommen till en roll där du både leder, utvecklar och driver teknikområdet framåt.* 




  





**Din roll** 




 Du blir en central del av Bankgirots omfattande transformationsresa och får en nyckelroll i att bygga vår helt nya "Greenfield"-lösning för en framtidssäker betalningsinfrastruktur.
 



 Det här är en unik möjlighet för dig som vill vara med från grunden och skapa en modern plattform som formar Sveriges betalflöden.
 



 Vi söker dig som har
 



  





 Som Tech Lead Datacenter får du en central roll i att forma och utveckla Bankgirots framtida datacenterkapacitet. Rollen innebär att du ser helheten, utmanar befintliga arbetssätt och driver förbättringar som får direkt betydelse för en verksamhet med höga krav på tillgänglighet och säkerhet. Mycket är på plats, men utvecklingen går snabbt – och du blir en nyckelperson i att leda nästa steg i resan. Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
 



  




* Helhetsansvar – från planering och drift till säkerhet, stabilitet och långsiktig utveckling och drift av datacentermiljön med fokus på kapacitet, tillgänglighet och effektivitet.
* Planering & samordning – koordinera och arbeta nära tekniska team och leverantörer samt driva förbättrings- och utvecklingsinitiativ.
* Säkerhet & ordning – säkerställa att datacentret följer höga krav på fysisk och teknisk säkerhet samt stödja hantering av incidenter.
* Utveckling & modernisering – bidra till strukturerade arbetssätt, automatisering och kontinuerlig vidareutveckling av miljön så att den är robust och modern för framtidens behov.



  





 Det här är en roll för dig som vill ta ansvar för en kritisk del av infrastrukturen i en verksamhet som befinner sig i ett spännande läge – med mycket som byggs, förfinas och utvecklas. Du kliver in där det händer nu, och får möjlighet att påverka både riktningen och detaljerna framåt. Datacentermiljön omfattar fysisk infrastruktur, redundanta datacenterlösningar, nätverk, kapacitetsplanering och övervakning. Du arbetar i en miljö med höga krav på stabilitet, säkerhet och tillgänglighet, där modernisering, automatisering och strukturerade arbetssätt är i fokus.
 



  





  





**Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner** 




 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
 



 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
 



  





 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
 



  





**Intresserad?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230
 



 alternativt Artan Bitiqi: artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com eller +46 723 61 28 44.
 



  





  





 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Om Bankgirot** 




 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
 



 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
 



 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Dev Business Analyst, Principal
description:
To strengthen our development organization, we are seeking a strategic and industry-savvy Principal Industry Business Analyst with deep hands-on experience from sectors such as Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete Manufacturing, or Process Manufacturing. This is a prime opportunity for a professional who understands ERP both from a business and technical perspective and who is passionate about driving product innovation at the heart of our solutions.
   

 This role is ideal for someone who has worked closely with ERP systems—whether in consulting, customer-facing roles, or as a key user—and who wants to leverage that experience to help shape and evolve our product portfolio.
   

  

 Your Role
   

 As a Principal Industry Business Analyst, you will be the authoritative voice of industry within Product Development. Collaborating closely with the Industry Product Manager, you will help define and prioritize the product roadmap to ensure new features and enhancements directly address real-world business challenges and industry trends.
   

 You will act as a Product Owner in agile teams, taking responsibility for clarifying requirements, defining detailed use cases, and ensuring development outputs meet the highest standards of industry relevance and customer value. Your engagement will also extend to selected customer interactions, gathering critical insights that shape our product vision and strategy.
   

 In this pivotal role, your deep industry knowledge, structured analytical approach, and excellent communication skills will bridge the gap between market needs and technical execution.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

 \* Serve as the trusted industry expert within Product Development teams.
   

 \* Collaborate on roadmap planning by conducting thorough market research and industry analysis, translating the roadmap into actionable development plans.
   

 \* Decompose complex business challenges into clear, prioritized requirements and user stories.
   

 \* Document and manage comprehensive use cases and feature sets reflecting industry standards.
   

 \* Define high-level solution designs that align with industry best practices.
   

 \* Own and manage the product backlog within agile delivery teams.
   

 \* Advocate for the customer perspective throughout the development lifecycle.
   

 \* Stay informed on Infor technologies and emerging industry trends to inform product innovation.
   

 \* Support initiatives involving GenAI/ML by providing industry-specific expertise and use cases.
   

 \* Develop industry-specific content, including widgets, process catalogs, persona-based workspaces, and composite applications.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 \* Experienced professional with industry knowledge in Fashion, Food & Beverage, Distribution, Discrete or Process Manufacturing.
   

 \* Familiarity with Infor M3 and/or ERP implementation projects is highly valued.
   

 \* Strong ability to analyze complex business requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.
   

 \* Exceptional communicator, comfortable presenting and writing for diverse audiences.
   

 \* Proven track record in customer-facing roles, adept at building relationships and gathering actionable insights.
   

 \* Self-driven with excellent organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills.
   

 \* Balanced mindset blending business acumen with technical understanding.
   

 \* Fluent in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.
   

  

 If you have hands-on experience working with ERP solutions—particularly within consulting or as a key user in relevant industries—this role offers an ideal platform to influence the future of industry-focused software. Join us and be part of a team shaping innovation and delivering real impact.
   

  

 About Infor
   

  

 Infor is where ambition meets impact. Join a global community of bold thinkers and innovators, where your expertise doesn’t just solve problems. it shapes industries, unlocks opportunities, and creates real-world impact for billions of people. At Infor, you’re not just building a career. you’re helping to build what’s next.
   

  

 Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
   

  

 For more information visit [1] www.infor.com
   

  

  

 References
   

  

 Visible links
   

 1. https://www.infor.com/
   

  

 Our Values
   

  

 At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization.
   

  

 We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM™. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.
   

  

 Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the [2] FAQ section.
   

  

 Fraud Awareness
   

  

 We have been made aware of unauthorized individuals posing as Infor recruiters, including some who have made fraudulent offers of employment. Please read our [3] guidelines and protect yourself from recruitment scams.
   

  

 Fraud Privacy Policy
   

  

 We value your privacy at Infor. You may access our privacy policy [4] here.
